verses.verse: The burden <WH4853> which Habakkuk <WH2265> the prophet <WH5030> did see <WH2372>.
O LORD <WH3068>, how long shall I cry <WH7768>, and thou wilt not hear <WH8085>! even cry out <WH2199> unto thee of violence <WH2555>, and thou wilt not save <WH3467>!

Why dost thou shew <WH7200> me iniquity <WH205>, and cause me to behold <WH5027> grievance <WH5999>? for spoiling <WH7701> and violence <WH2555> are before me: and there are that raise up <WH5375> strife <WH7379> and contention <WH4066>.

Therefore the law <WH8451> is slacked <WH6313>, and judgment <WH4941> doth never <WH5331> go forth <WH3318>: for the wicked <WH7563> doth compass <WH3803> about the righteous <WH6662>; therefore wrong <WH6127> judgment <WH4941> proceedeth <WH3318>.

¶ Behold <WH7200> ye among the heathen <WH1471>, and regard <WH5027>, and wonder <WH8539> marvellously <WH8539>: for I will work <WH6466> a work <WH6467> in your days <WH3117>, which ye will not believe <WH539>, though it be told <WH5608> you.

For, lo, I raise up <WH6965> the Chaldeans <WH3778>, that bitter <WH4751> and hasty <WH4116> nation <WH1471>, which shall march <WH1980> through the breadth <WH4800> of the land <WH776>, to possess <WH3423> the dwellingplaces <WH4908> that are not theirs.
They are terrible <WH366> and dreadful <WH3372>: their judgment <WH4941> and their dignity <WH7613> shall proceed <WH3318> of themselves.

Their horses <WH5483> also are swifter <WH7043> than the leopards <WH5246>, and are more fierce <WH2300> than the evening <WH6153> wolves <WH2061>: and their horsemen <WH6571> shall spread <WH6335> themselves, and their horsemen <WH6571> shall come <WH935> from far <WH7350>; they shall fly <WH5774> as the eagle <WH5404> that hasteth <WH2363> to eat <WH398>.
They shall come <WH935> all for violence <WH2555>: their faces <WH6440> shall sup up <WH4041> as the east wind <WH6921>, and they shall gather <WH622> the captivity <WH7628> as the sand <WH2344>.

And they shall scoff <WH7046> at the kings <WH4428>, and the princes <WH7336> shall be a scorn <WH4890> unto them: they shall deride <WH7832> every strong hold <WH4013>; for they shall heap <WH6651> dust <WH6083>, and take <WH3920> it.
Then shall his mind <WH7307> change <WH2498>, and he shall pass over <WH5674>, and offend <WH816>, imputing this <WH2098> his power <WH3581> unto his god <WH433>.

¶ Art thou not from everlasting <WH6924>, O LORD <WH3068> my God <WH430>, mine Holy One <WH6918>? we shall not die <WH4191>. O LORD <WH3068>, thou hast ordained <WH7760> them for judgment <WH4941>; and, O mighty God <WH6697>, thou hast established <WH3245> them for correction <WH3198>.

Thou art of purer <WH2889> eyes <WH5869> than to behold <WH7200> evil <WH7451>, and canst <WH3201> not look <WH5027> on iniquity <WH5999>: wherefore lookest <WH5027> thou upon them that deal treacherously <WH898>, and holdest thy tongue <WH2790> when the wicked <WH7563> devoureth <WH1104> the man that is more righteous <WH6662> than he?
And makest <WH6213> men <WH120> as the fishes <WH1709> of the sea <WH3220>, as the creeping things <WH7431>, that have no ruler <WH4910> over them?

They take up <WH5927> all of them with the angle <WH2443>, they catch <WH1641> them in their net <WH2764>, and gather <WH622> them in their drag <WH4365>: therefore they rejoice <WH8055> and are glad <WH1523>.

Therefore they sacrifice <WH2076> unto their net <WH2764>, and burn incense <WH6999> unto their drag <WH4365>; because by them <WH1992> their portion <WH2506> is fat <WH8082>, and their meat <WH3978> plenteous <WH1277>.
Shall they therefore empty <WH7324> their net <WH2764>, and not spare <WH2550> continually <WH8548> to slay <WH2026> the nations <WH1471>?
